abstract: Brazil's political establishment is being roiled by sweeping corruption investigation that has ensnared many of its top figures and cast shadow on Pres Dilma Rousseff; situation, coming amid stumbling economy, is plunging nation into worst state of political uncertainty since democracy was established in 1980s; opposition Brazilian Social Democracy Party is showing little desire to step into leadership void.
lead_paragraph: Some Brazilians are calling for the impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff amid corruption scandals. And the sense of political uncertainty ranks among the country’s worst since the 1980s.

headline.main: Scandals in Brazil Prompt Fears of a Return to Turmoil
headline.print_headline: An Anticorruption Drive Throws Brazil’s Leadership Into Disarray

snippet: Some Brazilians are calling for the impeachment of President Dilma Rousseff amid corruption scandals. And the sense of political uncertainty ranks among the country’s worst since the 1980s.
